panels.description:
Internet Connection is based on a ping data from CollectD against 1.1.1.1. 
If the ping is higher than 50ms, it will turn yellow-ish. If its over 100ms, it will turn red.
panels.title: Internet Connection

panels.description:
WAN IP data is gathered via the 1-min-script. it will curl a public site to get the Public IP. The WAN IP is gathered locally from WRT. It is then outputted to a file in /tmp/wanip.out. 

https://github.com/benisai/Openwrt-Monitoring/blob/main/Router/scripts/1-minute-script.sh
panels.title: WAN IP

panels.description:
Network Health is based on a ping data from CollectD against 1.1.1.1. 
If the ping is higher than 50ms, it will turn yellow-ish. If its over 100ms, it will turn red.
panels.title: Network Health

panels.description:
SpeedTest data is gathered from the speedtest.sh script. It is then outputted to /tmp/speedtest.out file for Prometheus to collect. If there is no data from the script, more than likely the testhost (netperf.bufferbloat.net) blocked you from attempting speedtests, try again in a few hours. 

https://github.com/benisai/Openwrt-Monitoring/blob/main/Router/scripts/speedtest.sh

defaults.noValue: Looks like speedtest.sh script did not run

panels.title: SpeedTest

panels.description:
PacketLoss data is based on ping data collected via the 1-min-script.sh. It will ping 1.1.1.1  20 times and the script will record any packet drops. 

https://github.com/benisai/Openwrt-Monitoring/blob/main/Router/scripts/1-minute-script.sh
panels.title: Packet Loss

panels.description:
/usr/bin/device-status-ping.sh script will ping IP Addr in /tmp/dhcp.lease file. 
The device-status-ping.sh script will run every minute via crontab and output a file to tmp/device-status.out

Some devices dont respond to pings, I dont know why. 


https://github.com/benisai/Openwrt-Monitoring/blob/main/Router/scripts/device-status-ping.sh
panels.title: Clients

panels.description:
Bandwidth Usage Provided by Vnstat2. The 1-min-script.sh will parse and output a file to /tmp/monthoutput.out for Prometheus to scrape.  



The cap is set in this panel:
Max
Leave empty to calculate based on all values


https://github.com/benisai/Openwrt-Monitoring/blob/main/Router/scripts/1-minute-script.sh
panels.title: Bandwidth Usage - 150GB Cap
